intro: Baccharis phlogopappa, commonly known as flamebrush, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its dense, upright growth habit and its striking, fiery orange to red foliage, which becomes more vivid in the fall. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers in panicles during the late summer to early fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
